Package com.hissain.jscipy.signal.fft

Class Hilbert

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hissain.jscipy.signal.fft.Hilbert
  • public class Hilbert
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a method to compute the analytic signal using the Hilbert transform. The Hilbert transform is a linear operator that takes a function, u(t), and produces a function, H(u)(t), with the same domain. The Hilbert transform is important in signal processing, where it gives rise to the analytic representation of a signal.

      Hilbert()
      Constructs a Hilbert transformer.

    • Method Detail

      • hilbert

        public JComplex[] hilbert​(double[] signal)
        Computes the analytic signal of a real-valued input array. The analytic signal of a real-valued signal `x(t)` is a complex-valued signal `z(t) = x(t) + j*y(t)`, where `y(t)` is the Hilbert transform of `x(t)`.
        Parameters:
        signal - The real-valued input signal array.
        Returns:
        The complex-valued analytic signal.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the input signal is null.
